document.text:
From: 
Subject: Re: Maxwell 
Date: Fri, 24 Jul 2020 22:10:11 +0000 
Yes. I  told him he's need to get legal advice from his general counsel (or whoever), I appealed to him more on 
the ethics side of it. And told him about the secrecy of grand juries, which he was fuzzy on. 
Sent from my iPhone 
On Jul 24, 2020, at 6:08 PM, wrote: 
This sounds like he's trying to get protection from legal liability or legal advice he should be getting from counsel, 
not us, doesn't it? 
From: 
Sent: Friday, July 24, 2020 5:44 PM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: Fwd: Maxwell 
In the meantime, I just noticed that he responded with this. 
Sent from my iPhone 
Begin forwarded message: 
From: 
Date: July 24 2020 at 3:46:31 PM EDT 
To: 
Subject: Re: Maxwell 
Many thanksli.  Can you please let me know if there is a specific legal barrier to me naming any of the
alleged victims given that (a) they are no longer minors and (b) that at least two of them 
 have waived anonymity in the past to speak out as survivors of Epstein's abuse? 
Best 
EFTA00021933

London 
SE1 9GF 
On Fri, 24 Jul 2020 at 18:58 wrote: 
Hello. Your email was forwarded to me by Please note that prosecutors in this office are not 
available for media inquiries. You can forward any further inquiries to the press office. 
We cannot comment or provide any guidance on your questions. 
Best, 
Spokesman 
United States Department of Justice 
U.S. Attorney's Office I Southern District of New York 
Sent from my iPhone 
"Please consider the 
environment before printing this e-mail" 
EFTA00021934
